newsitem.title: USA: NBA BASKETBALL-CHICAGO BULLS FINED $25,000 FOR MEDIA SNUB.
newsitem.headline: NBA BASKETBALL-CHICAGO BULLS FINED $25,000 FOR MEDIA SNUB.

text.p: The Chicago Bulls organisation was fined $25,000 by the National Basketball Association Thursday for failing to make its players available to the media on Wednesday following a practice session for their second-round playoff series with the Atlanta Hawks.

The league announced the financial sanction in a brief statement, saying that all NBA teams are required to make their coaches and players available to the media for a 30-minute period before or after all off-day workouts during the playoffs.
The defending NBA champion Bulls host Game Two of their best-of-seven Eastern Conference semifinal Thursday night after winning the series opener 100-97 on Tuesday.
